page.title: 10DELANCEY PARK
page.content: Delancey park was first open to the public in 1913 just before the First World War.Some of the trees were planted for the Queens jubilee.All the parts of the park are open to the public,such as the swings, slides, tennis courts, bowling greens,cricket and football pitches ,and also a hockey pitch. You can see all the Channel Islands, such as Jethou, Jersey, Sark, Herm, Alderney and France on a fine day. There are four public toilets, and four German bunkers remaining from the Occupation. St.Sampson's school use the park everyday, as do clubs from England and local clubs for various activities. There are 16 seats to sit on and two park keepers are employed. Delancey Park is the biggest park in Guernsey,with a monument in the middle.
